metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3999 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in glibc. An off-by-one buffer overflow and underflow in getcwd() may lead to memory corruption when the size of the buffer is exactly 1. A local attacker who can control the input buffer and size passed to getcwd() in a setuid program could use this flaw to potentially execute arbitrary code and escalate their privileges on the system.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3999` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
libc-bin - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
libc6 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
libc6-amd64 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
libc6-armel - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
libc6-i386 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
libc6-pic - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
libc6-s390 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
libc6-x32 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
locales - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
locales-all - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
multiarch-support - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
nscd - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glibc package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm1').
